description:
The customer is king in today's manufacturing environment, and meeting and exceeding customer demands has become the fundamental requirement for a company's success. In today's competitive environment, decisions must be made immediately and on-the-spot. Manufacturing and supply chain professionals must reconsider every aspect of this streamlined manufacturing approach or they risk being left behind in the race to both cut costs and reduce time.

This course was designed based on the instructor's real-world knowledge and experience, gained through hands-on operations. It will enable you to improve the manufacturing planning and control function within your company as a whole, by teaching you the basic principles and best practices of production management.

You'll learn effective methods and techniques for aligning manufacturing and company's business strategy; managing master production schedule and material requirements planning for better value creation; managing S&OP and distribution requirements planning for better serve customers by reducing stock-outs, delivery and demand times; planning, managing and executing capacity and production activity control; and developing a framework for designing and managing the manufacturing planning and control functions.

Content and Overview:

This course contains 76 lectures, 9+ hours of content organized in 12 areas, and quizzes containing 100+ questions. It's perfect for manufacturing professionals and students of manufacturing operations and manufacturing management systems at every level seeking a basic and more advanced understanding of manufacturing planning, execution, and control systems and supply chain integration.

The content areas include:

  • The Basics of Manufacturing Planning and Control
  • Enterprise Resource Planning
  • Demand Management
  • Forecasting
  • Sales and Operations Planning
  • Master Production Scheduling
  • Materials Requirements Planning
  • Capacity Planning and Management
  • Production Activity Control
  • Just-in-Time
  • Distribution Requirements Planning
  • Manufacturing Planning and Control Design

By completing this course, you'll be armed with the valuable and practical skills you need to improve both your personal performance as a manufacturing professional, and the overall performance of your company's manufacturing function as an integral part of the supply chain. The course will provide you with the information and analysis you need to remain both current and competitive; the state-of-the-art knowledge and practices you need to meet your customer's demands and requirements; and the details to meet them with dramatically greater speed and precision than your competitors.
title: Manufacturing Planning and Control
